items.title: More than 350 structures lost to Vic bushfires as locals assess damage
items.description: Some residents have returned home to take stock of the devastation. Meanwhile, authorities believe the Longwood fire was started by a trailer throwing sparks on the Hume Freeway.

items.title: PM recalls parliament to introduce hate speech and gun laws
items.description: Anthony Albanese has recalled parliament early to deal with sweeping hate speech and gun laws in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Adelaide Writers' Week 'hangs in the balance' as Jacinda Ardern joins list of authors boycotting event
items.description: The future of Adelaide Writers' Week (AWW) remains unclear as Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah says she is considering her legal options. Former New Zealand prime minister Jacinda Ardern is among those who will no longer appear at the event.

items.title: 'This won't end well': US Fed Reserve chair facing criminal probe
items.description: The US attorney's office in the District of Columbia has opened a criminal investigation into Jerome Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve.

items.title: Danish PM says Greenland feud at a 'decisive moment' after new Trump threats
items.description: Donald Trump says controlling Greenland is crucial for US national security and he has suggested using force to seize the Arctic territory.

items.title: If Iran is 'done with this regime' could the son of the former Shah return?
items.description: Iranians have endured a blackout but for many the fears of atrocities committed by the Khamenei regime are real and based on reports of machine guns being used.

items.title: Man fronts court over duct taped vest near Bondi Beach
items.description: A man allegedly carrying a vest covered in duct-taped objects in Bondi has been arrested and charged by NSW Police, with his vest examined by the bomb disposal unit and deemed safe.

items.title: Imam thanks police after alleged roadside assault in Melbourne
items.description: An imam who was allegedly the victim of racial abuse during a roadside assault has thanked the police who helped him and his wife, and urged Australians to reject hate, Islamophobia and antisemitism.

items.title: Golden Globes key moments: Chalamet bests Dicaprio, Rose Byrne shouts out her bearded dragon
items.description: This year's Golden Globes saw hits and misses for Australia, last-minute snubs and a humbled Timothée Chalamet.

items.title: More than the US and UK, the Taliban has an issue with Australia
items.description: The Taliban's chief spokesman agreed to an unscripted, sit-down interview with me, there was just one non-negotiable condition, writes Meghna Bali.

items.title: Why Minneapolis was the place where ICE launched its largest operation yet
items.description: Minneapolis had been the target of a massive immigration enforcement operation in the weeks leading up to Renee Nicole Good's death. Now, the shooting has opened old wounds.

items.title: 'The hero of Bondi Junction' stabbing attack diagnosed with rare cancer
items.description: NSW Police Inspector Amy Scott, who was praised for bringing the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing attack to an end, has been diagnosed with a rare and aggressive form of breast cancer.

items.title: NT rejects national gun buyback scheme over co-funding proposal
items.description: The Northern Territory government says it does not support the Commonwealth's proposed national gun buyback scheme, stating the territory should not have to share the cost 50:50.

items.title: 'It's not okay to not talk about it': Kostyuk explains handshake stance
items.description: Marta Kostyuk explained that not shaking Aryna Sabalenka's hand and talking about Ukraine following her Brisbane International defeat was her duty, and to not highlight the issues at home would be "inhumane".

items.title: Investigation underway after woman found dead at Logan home
items.description: An investigation is underway after a woman was found dead at a house in Buccan, south of Brisbane.

items.title: WA authorities still powerless to shut down illicit tobacco and vape shops
items.description: An eastern states public health expert says "it's a mystery" why Western Australia is lagging behind the rest of the country on updating its illicit tobacco laws.

items.title: How I have fun with friends without spending money
items.description: I've kept low-cost, high-fun habits alive for years, even after returning home to a city where socialising often seems to mean shelling out.

items.title: 'We can't survive it': The suburbs fighting against fast food giants
items.description: Nutrition, vibe and culture concerns fuel these communities that want to protect their suburbs' identity and businesses from the fast food giants.

items.title: Elite sportswomen have shared their stories, and these are the hard truths
items.description: Low pay, discrimination, disordered eating, sexism and online abuse are just a few of the prevalent issues ABC's Elite Athletes in Women's Sport Survey has revealed, despite recent progress in women's sport.

items.title: Perth woman suffers severe reaction after taking herbal remedy ArmaForce
items.description: A popular supplement linked to hundreds of adverse events is again in the spotlight after a Perth woman was hospitalised after taking over-the-counter herbal remedy ArmaForce.

items.title: Police seize 19 vehicles after dangerous driving at Summernats
items.description: A major police operation at Summernats has resulted in 19 vehicle seizures, hundreds of traffic offences and multiple arrests.

items.title: Police confirm multiple shots in Mullewa incident, renew plea to alleged gunman
items.description: Officers have issued another plea to Kenneth John Giles to surrender, with the 58-year-old unsighted since Wednesday evenings shooting in Mullewa.

items.title: Why there are no Michelin-starred restaurants in Australia
items.description: If you're a food lover, chances are you've heard of the Michelin Guide – you may have even dined at a Michelin-starred restaurant, but not here in Australia.

items.title: Labor pledges fertility treatment rebates ahead of election
items.description: Families will be able to access fertility treatment rebates of up to $2,000 per cycle for two cycles, under a Labor promise announced ahead of the upcoming state election.

items.title: Federal minister backs axing of Palestinian author from writers' festival
items.description: Resources Minister Madeleine King's comments come amid a growing furore over the decision that has led several board members to resign and dozens of writers to withdraw from the Adelaide literary event.
